reviews.review_msg: He is a very good teacher and helps a lot whenever you ask him questions. Puts a lot of effort in the lectures. His homeworks, midterms and finals have some of the most beautiful problems you can get in this course.
he's cute, but he's material is hard..... but he really likes to help if u go to him....
I think he's good. Very clear notes, but assingments are harder than notes.
Best math prof @ SFU. Incredible lecturer, well-crafted assignments, very fair exams. She set aside lots of time for office hours each week. Clearly cared about our learning.

Dr. Nigam is by far the best math prof I've had during my undergraduate career. She truly cares about each student's learning, encourages discussion and participation in class and takes her time with you in her office hours to re-explain concepts you're struggling with. Warning: this class is rough and the homework is brutal. You need to work hard
Such a wonderful prof. Very difficult, but very caring for her students.

This is simultaneously one of the most stressful and rewarding courses I have ever taken. Dr. Nigam has the strange ability to really motivate her students to work hard, but damn do you have to work hard to achieve anything in this course. She starts the course off by basically talking you out of it, but gives A LOT of support throughout.

Worst teacher I've ever had. Did several incomprehensible theorems and proofs every class and gave impossible homework. Gave a list of  70 theorems we had to be able to state and 30 theorems we had to be able to prove for the final. She barely asked anything from the list on the final exam. Inapproachable and an extremely incompetent teacher.

i don't know who made her a teacher. she doesn't teach, she just throws out an unlimited number of theorems/proofs in your face, and magically u re supposed to know everything in the textbook. worst proffessor ever, and worst class ever
don't know what's going on in the lecture! very bored!!!

He's a great choice for a real analysis course because he makes it a lot easier than it could otherwise be. Exams and homework are challenging because analysis is a painful subject regardless of who teaches, but he is quite good at it. Definitely would recommend - an A+ is doable.

the lectures are vivid with examples... he is quite good in teaching... I believe that his marking is quite fair... but worse thing is we have a stupid TA.. marking heavily on our assignments and the midterms as well. even though you wrote a lot.. you would get 0/5 (this equals to do nothing) TA's are unclear and the hints do not help at all.

His experience with teaching real analysis truly shines and his comments are very insightful.  The material is very difficult, and you'll have to suffer through topology at the beginning, but you'll get to nice and useful results at the end of the course. Know your definitions and homework solutions well for tests.
He is an awesome teacher! Even if people keep asking stupid questions, he answers all of them calmly. Make sure you do your homework as it's easily testable.
